description: Subsets of natural numbers arranged in standard statistical (or Yates) order.
references: S. Hedayat, N. J. A. Sloane and J. Stufken, Orthogonal Arrays, Springer-Verlag, NY, 1999, p. 249.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: Constructed recursively: subsets that include n are obtained by appending n to all earlier subsets.
mathematica: nmax = 6; s[0] = {{}}; s[n_] := s[n] = Join[s[n-1], Append[#, n]& /@ s[n-1]]; FromDigits /@ s[nmax] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 15 2011 *)
prog: (C:) #include <stdio.h> #include <stdlib.h> #define USAGE "Usage: 'A048794 num' where num is the largest number to use creating sets.\n" #define MAX_NUM 10 #define MAX_ROW 1024 int main(int argc, char *argv[]) { unsigned char a[MAX_ROW][MAX_NUM]; signed short old_row, new_row, i, j, end; if (argc < 2) { fprintf(stderr, USAGE); return EXIT_FAILURE; } end = atoi(argv[1]); end = (end > MAX_NUM) ? MAX_NUM: end; for (i = 0; i < MAX_ROW; i++) for ( j = 0; j < MAX_NUM; j++) a[i][j] = 0; a[1][0] = '1'; new_row = 2; for (i = 2; i <= end; i++) { sprintf(&a[new_row++ ][0], "%d", i); for (old_row = 1; a[old_row][0] != (i+48); old_row++) { sprintf(&a[new_row++ ][0], "%s%d", &a[old_row][0], i); } } fprintf(stdout, "Values: 0"); for (i = 1; a[i][0] != 0; i++) fprintf(stdout, ",%s", &a[i][0]); fprintf(stdout, "\n"); return EXIT_SUCCESS; }(Haskell)a048794 n = a048794_list !! na048794_list = map (read . concatMap show) a048793_tabf :: [Integer]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 16 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Apr 11 2000
Keyword base added by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 16 2013
